# Region 1: [North Coast Regional Water Board](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/northcoast/)

## Jurisdiction
- Del Norte, Humboldt, Trinity, Mendocino, and portions of Sonoma and Glenn counties
- 10.5 million acres
- 340 miles of coastline

## Headquarters
- **Santa Rosa**: 5550 Skylane Blvd, Suite A
- **Phone**: (707) 576-2220

## Key Programs
- Timber harvest oversight
- Agricultural water quality
- Cannabis cultivation permits — see [board decisions](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/northcoast/board_decisions/)
- Wastewater permits
- Cleanup oversight

## Unique Characteristics
- Rural, sparsely populated
- Heavy forestry influence
- Cannabis industry regulation
- Tribal lands considerations
- Klamath River watershed — tracked under [Region 1 TMDLs](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/northcoast/water_issues/programs/tmdls/)

## Major Watersheds
- Klamath River
- Trinity River
- Eel River
- Russian River (upper)
- Mattole River

## Current Priorities
- Cannabis cultivation impacts
- Sediment and erosion
- Timber harvest practices
- Tribal water quality
- Small community assistance

## Take Action

1. **Visit the [North Coast Regional Water Board homepage](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/northcoast/)** to find meeting schedules, permits, and current programs for your area.
2. **Check if you're in Region 1** using the [interactive waterboards map](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/waterboards_map.html) — the region covers Del Norte through Mendocino counties and portions of Sonoma.
3. **Review board decisions and enforcement** at the [Region 1 board decisions page](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/northcoast/board_decisions/).
4. **Contact the board** at (707) 576-2220 or find email and mailing info in the [Regional Board Directory](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/about_us/contact_us/rwqcbs_directory.html).

# Region 2: [San Francisco Bay Regional Water Board](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/sanfranciscobay/)

## Jurisdiction
- Nine Bay Area counties
- San Francisco, Alameda, Contra Costa, Santa Clara, San Mateo, Marin, Sonoma, Napa, Solano (portions)

## Headquarters
- **Oakland**: 1515 Clay Street, Suite 1400
- **Phone**: (510) 622-2300

## Key Programs
- [Municipal stormwater (MS4) permits](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/rwqcb2/water_issues/programs/stormwater/)
- Industrial stormwater
- NPDES wastewater permits
- Site cleanup (Superfund, LUST)
- Wetlands protection

## Major Issues
- San Francisco Bay health
- Urban stormwater runoff
- Sea level rise adaptation
- Legacy contamination sites
- Nutrient management

## Notable Sites
- Hunters Point Naval Shipyard
- Treasure Island
- Numerous tech industry sites
- Petroleum facility cleanups

## TMDLs
- Mercury in San Francisco Bay
- PCBs in Bay
- Sediment
- Pathogens (beaches)

## Contact
- General info: info@waterboards.ca.gov
- [Enforcement actions](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/sanfranciscobay/board_decisions/enforcement.html)
- Complaints: Online reporting system

## Take Action

1. **Visit the [SF Bay Regional Water Board homepage](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/sanfranciscobay/)** for permits, programs, and meeting schedules covering the nine Bay Area counties.
2. **Check stormwater programs** at the [Region 2 stormwater page](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/rwqcb2/water_issues/programs/stormwater/) for MS4 permit requirements and compliance resources.
3. **Review enforcement actions** at the [Region 2 enforcement page](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/sanfranciscobay/board_decisions/enforcement.html) for active cleanup sites and violations.
4. **Find your region** on the [interactive map](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/waterboards_map.html) and contact details in the [Regional Board Directory](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/about_us/contact_us/rwqcbs_directory.html).

# Region 3: [Central Coast Regional Water Board](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/centralcoast/)

## Jurisdiction
- Santa Cruz, San Benito, Monterey, San Luis Obispo, Santa Barbara, and portions of Ventura, Santa Clara, and Kern counties
- 300+ miles of coastline

## Headquarters
- **San Luis Obispo**: 895 Aerovista Place, Suite 101
- **Phone**: (805) 549-3147

## Key Programs
- [Agricultural water quality](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/centralcoast/water_issues/programs/)
- Wine industry wastewater
- Onsite wastewater (septic)
- Stormwater permits
- Coastal protection

## Agriculture Focus
- Major agricultural region
- Irrigated agriculture order
- Salinas Valley ag water quality
- Strawberry and vegetable farming
- Vineyard wastewater

## Coastal Issues
- Beach water quality
- Marine protected areas
- Desalination facilities
- Coastal erosion
- Sea level rise

## TMDLs
- Nitrate in Salinas Valley
- Pathogens in beaches
- Sediment
- Pesticides

## Unique Programs
- Agricultural Order 4.0
- Vineyard wastewater guidance
- [Cannabis cultivation permits](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/centralcoast/water_issues/programs/cannabis_cultivation/)
- Small community assistance

## Take Action

1. **Visit the [Central Coast Regional Water Board homepage](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/centralcoast/)** for meeting schedules, permits, and agricultural water quality programs.
2. **Review regional programs** at the [Region 3 programs page](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/centralcoast/water_issues/programs/) for agricultural orders, vineyard wastewater, and coastal protection.
3. **Check if you're in Region 3** using the [interactive map](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/waterboards_map.html) — coverage includes Santa Cruz through Santa Barbara counties.
4. **Contact the board** at (805) 549-3147 or find details in the [Regional Board Directory](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/about_us/contact_us/rwqcbs_directory.html).

# Region 4: [Los Angeles Regional Water Board](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/losangeles/)

## Jurisdiction
- Los Angeles and Ventura counties
- Portions of Kern and Santa Barbara counties
- 4,200+ square miles
- 13 million residents

## Headquarters
- **Los Angeles**: 320 West 4th Street, Suite 200
- **Phone**: (213) 576-6600

## Key Programs
- [Municipal stormwater (LA MS4 permit)](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/losangeles/water_issues/programs/stormwater/)
- Industrial stormwater
- NPDES permits
- Site cleanup (Superfund, LUST)
- TMDLs

## Urban Focus
- Highly urbanized region
- Extensive stormwater infrastructure
- Major industrial legacy
- Significant cleanup sites

## Major TMDLs
- Trash (pioneering TMDL)
- Bacteria (beaches)
- Metals in LA River
- DDT/PCBs in bays
- Nutrient management

## Notable Programs
- Santa Monica Bay restoration — see the [LA Basin Plan](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/losangeles/water_issues/programs/basin_plan/) for water quality objectives
- Los Angeles River revitalization
- Beach water quality monitoring
- Enhanced Watershed Management Programs

## Contact
- General inquiries: (213) 576-6600
- Public complaints: Online system
- Records requests: Public Records Act process

## Take Action

1. **Visit the [LA Regional Water Board homepage](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/losangeles/)** for permits, enforcement actions, and public meeting schedules for LA and Ventura counties.
2. **Review the Basin Plan** at the [Region 4 Basin Plan page](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/losangeles/water_issues/programs/basin_plan/) for water quality objectives and TMDLs in your watershed.
3. **Check stormwater programs** at the [Region 4 stormwater page](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/losangeles/water_issues/programs/stormwater/) for MS4 compliance and Enhanced Watershed Management Programs.
4. **Find contact details** in the [Regional Board Directory](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/about_us/contact_us/rwqcbs_directory.html) or call (213) 576-6600.

# Region 5: [Central Valley Regional Water Board](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/centralvalley/)

## Jurisdiction
- Largest region: Sacramento and San Joaquin River basins
- Tulare Lake Basin
- 40% of California's land area
- Major agricultural region

## Offices
- **Rancho Cordova (HQ)**: 11020 Sun Center Drive, Suite 200
- **Fresno**: 1685 E Street
- **Redding**: 364 Knollcrest Drive, Suite 205

## Key Programs
- [Agricultural water quality](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/centralvalley/)
- Dairy operations regulation
- Wastewater permits
- Site cleanup
- Irrigated lands regulatory program

## Agricultural Focus
- Largest agricultural output in nation
- Dairy waste management
- Fertilizer/nitrate management
- Irrigation return flows
- Pesticide runoff

## Major Issues
- Nitrate contamination
- Salinity management
- Subsidence from groundwater pumping
- Delta water quality
- CV-SALTS program

## TMDLs and Programs
- Delta methylmercury
- San Joaquin River salt and boron
- Dairy general order
- Irrigated Lands Regulatory Program — see also [oil field produced water program](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/centralvalley/water_issues/oil_fields/) and [cannabis cultivation permits](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/centralvalley/water_issues/cannabis/general_order/)

## Take Action

1. **Visit the [Central Valley Regional Water Board homepage](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/centralvalley/)** for meeting schedules, agricultural water quality programs, and permits across California's largest water board region.
2. **Review specialized programs** including the [oil fields program](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/centralvalley/water_issues/oil_fields/) and [cannabis cultivation permits](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/centralvalley/water_issues/cannabis/general_order/).
3. **Check if you're in Region 5** using the [interactive map](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/waterboards_map.html) — the region covers the Sacramento/San Joaquin basins and Tulare Lake Basin.
4. **Contact the appropriate office** — HQ in Rancho Cordova (916) 464-3291, Fresno (559) 445-5116, or Redding (530) 224-4845. Full details in the [Regional Board Directory](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/about_us/contact_us/rwqcbs_directory.html).

# Region 6: [Lahontan Regional Water Board](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/lahontan/)

## Jurisdiction
- Eastern Sierra from Oregon to LA County
- Mono and Inyo counties
- Portions of 8 other counties
- Lake Tahoe Basin

## Offices
- **South Lake Tahoe**: 2501 Lake Tahoe Blvd
- **Victorville**: 15095 Amargosa Road, Building 2

## Key Programs
- Lake Tahoe clarity protection — see [salt and nutrient management](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/lahontan/water_issues/programs/snmp/)
- Onsite wastewater systems
- Military installation cleanup
- Mining site remediation
- Ski resort stormwater

## Lake Tahoe Focus
- TMDL for clarity
- Stormwater management
- Shoreline development
- Forest management
- Tahoe Regional Planning Agency coordination

## Desert Issues
- Groundwater contamination
- Mining impacts — [401 certification](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/lahontan/water_issues/programs/clean_water_act_401/) required for federal permits
- Renewable energy projects
- Military bases (Fort Irwin, China Lake)

## Unique Challenges
- Vast geography, sparse population
- Extreme environments
- Interstate coordination (Nevada)
- Federal land management coordination

## Recreation Water Quality
- Lake Tahoe beaches
- Mono Lake
- Eastern Sierra lakes and streams

## Take Action

1. **Visit the [Lahontan Regional Water Board homepage](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/lahontan/)** for meeting schedules, Lake Tahoe programs, and desert region permits.
2. **Review the [Salt and Nutrient Management Plan](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/lahontan/water_issues/programs/snmp/)** for groundwater protection programs in the Lahontan region.
3. **Check 401 certification requirements** at the [Region 6 Clean Water Act 401 page](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/lahontan/water_issues/programs/clean_water_act_401/) for projects requiring federal permits.
4. **Find contact details** in the [Regional Board Directory](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/about_us/contact_us/rwqcbs_directory.html) — South Lake Tahoe office (530) 542-5400 or Victorville office (760) 241-6583.

# Region 7: [Colorado River Basin Regional Water Board](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/coloradoriver/)

## Jurisdiction
- Imperial and Riverside counties (portions)
- San Bernardino County (portions)
- Colorado River watershed in California

## Headquarters
- **Palm Desert**: 73-720 Fred Waring Drive, Suite 100
- **Phone**: (760) 346-7491

## Key Programs
- [Agricultural drainage](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/coloradoriver/)
- Salton Sea management
- Groundwater quality
- Wastewater permits
- Geothermal facilities

## Salton Sea
- Major regional issue
- Shrinking lake, exposed lakebed
- Dust control needs
- Habitat restoration
- Multi-agency coordination

## Agricultural Focus
- Imperial Valley irrigation
- Colorado River water use
- Tail water management
- Salinity challenges

## Unique Issues
- Desert environment
- High salinity waters — [enforcement actions](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/coloradoriver/water_issues/programs/enforcement/) for violations
- Geothermal development — [401 certification](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/coloradoriver/water_issues/programs/401_certification/) for federal permits
- Renewable energy projects
- International considerations (Mexico)

## Colorado River Quality
- Salinity management
- Interstate compact obligations
- Agricultural return flows
- Groundwater interface

## Take Action

1. **Visit the [Colorado River Basin Regional Water Board homepage](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/coloradoriver/)** for meeting schedules, Salton Sea updates, and agricultural water quality programs.
2. **Review enforcement actions** at the [Region 7 enforcement page](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/coloradoriver/water_issues/programs/enforcement/) for compliance orders and violations in the desert region.
3. **Check 401 certification requirements** at the [Region 7 certification page](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/coloradoriver/water_issues/programs/401_certification/) for projects needing federal permits.
4. **Contact the board** at (760) 346-7491 or find details in the [Regional Board Directory](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/about_us/contact_us/rwqcbs_directory.html).

- Public notification system

## Tijuana River Issues

- International coordination
- Sewage infrastructure needs
- Sediment management
- Federal partnership (IBWC)

- MCAS Miramar
- Naval facilities

- Sediment

1. **Visit the [San Diego Regional Water Board homepage](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/sandiego/)** for meeting schedules, beach water quality, and Tijuana River watershed updates.
2. **Review the Basin Plan** at the [Region 9 Basin Plan page](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/sandiego/water_issues/programs/basin_plan/) for water quality objectives and TMDLs.
3. **Check stormwater programs** at the [Region 9 stormwater page](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/sandiego/water_issues/programs/stormwater/) for MS4 permit compliance resources.
4. **Contact the board** at (619) 516-1990 or find details in the [Regional Board Directory](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/about_us/contact_us/rwqcbs_directory.html).

# How Regional Water Boards Interact with State Board

## Organizational Structure

### [State Water Resources Control Board](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/about_us/)
- Sets statewide policy
- Adopts statewide permits
- Allocates water rights
- Provides funding
- Appellate body for regional decisions

### [Regional Water Quality Control Boards](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/waterboards_map.html)
- Implement water quality programs
- Issue permits and enforcement
- Develop Basin Plans
- Local decision-making
- Nine regions across California

## Division of Responsibilities

### State Board Handles
- [Statewide general permits](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/water_issues/programs/) (CGP, IGP)
- Water rights
- Drinking water (DDW)
- Financial assistance
- Policy and regulations
- Appeals

### Regional Boards Handle
- Individual NPDES permits
- Waste discharge requirements
- Site cleanup oversight
- Enforcement actions
- Local basin planning
- Public complaints

## When to Contact Which

### Contact Regional Board For
- Specific site issues
- Permit applications
- Complaints about discharges
- Cleanup sites
- Local water quality issues

### Contact [State Board](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/about_us/contact_us/rwqcbs_directory.html) For
- Statewide permit questions
- Appeals of regional decisions
- Funding programs
- Drinking water issues
- Water rights
- Policy questions

## Take Action

1. **Determine which board to contact** — use the [interactive waterboards map](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/waterboards_map.html) to find your Regional Board for local issues, or contact the [State Board](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/about_us/) for statewide policy and appeals.
2. **Review available programs** at the [SWRCB Programs page](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/water_issues/programs/) to understand which are managed statewide vs. regionally.
3. **Find contact information** for both state and regional boards in the [Regional Board Directory](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/about_us/contact_us/rwqcbs_directory.html).
4. **Remember the division** — contact your Regional Board for site-specific issues, permits, and complaints; contact the State Board for appeals, water rights, drinking water, and funding programs.
